data.title: Sample Text Color from Image
data.body:
The idea is that we load an image (probably an image manipulator), and instead of text always sampling a solid color, it samples that image and uses it to color the text. 

We may need to scale the sampling up and down to compensate for the drawable resolution.

data.title: Support pre-6.11 games that overwrite config.layers.
data.body:
Some pre-6.11 games overwrite `config.layers` entirely and omit "screens", which makes sense given that the screen system wasn't a thing back then.

However, this breaks on modern Ren'Py which expects the layer to be there (see `renpy.get_screen()` et al.). This fix adds compatibility support for games with such old `script_version`s.

data.title: Adjusting the size of a movie sprite may not work.
Side may be broken with children that xfill/yfill
data.body:
Side offers the full width to its children, which - if they fill the area - means they'll render at the wrong
size.

data.title: Inconsistency between show and hide tag handling
data.body:
The hide function should accept a TAG or a name as input

```
def hide(name, layer=None):
    if renpy.game.context().init_phase:
        raise Exception("Hide may not run while in init phase.")

    if not isinstance(name, tuple):
        name = tuple(name.split())
```

as you can see the given tag is stripped after any space.
Instead if we look at the show function:

```
def show(name, at_list=[ ], layer=None, what=None, zorder=None, tag=None, behind=[ ], atl=None, transient=False, munge_name=True):

    if not isinstance(name, tuple):
        name = tuple(name.split())

    if zorder is None and not renpy.config.preserve_zorder:
        zorder = 0

    sls = scene_lists()
    key = tag or name[0]
```

the tag value is never stripped.

Therefore using a tag with spaces will result in an inconsistent state where you cannot hide displaying elements.

I temporary patched by adding

```
  if tag:
        if not isinstance(tag, tuple):
            tag = tuple(tag.split())[0]
```

to the show statement, 
but i don't know if it affects any other function

data.title: add install_headers to pygame_sdl2 build instructions
data.body: Apparently distutils & setuptools somewhat differ in what they install with `install` command. `setuptools` version (which is default in pygame_sdl2/setuplib.py) does not install headers and thus renpy `module` build fails unable to find them. Adding `install_headers` step seems to fix the problem and works on both setuptools & distutils.

data.title: __variable munging should work in string interpolation.
Windows 10 RAPT issues
data.body:
Renpy version: `6.99.9`
For some reason `run_slow` function in `install_sdk.py` always returns false, but i've JDK installed and it works well in my %path%

```
C:\Users\insci>javac -version
javac 1.8.0_74
```

I don't know how to debug in renpy so i can't provide tracebacks or some detailed info. Also i reinstalled renpy and rapt few times, it didn't help. I've changed run_slow to return always true for solve this problem.

Next issue i faced with android SDK, for some reason SDK downloaded by rapt don't have `\extras \google\play_licensing\library\build.xml` file, even when i reinstalled `Google play licensing library` few times. This problem caused by old SDK version, when i changed `sdk_version = "r23"` for `r24.4.1` in `plat.py` manually and reinstall android SDK everything started working well. Is this some reason to use old SDK version?
Finally i successfully builded android app and ran it, so i guess these problems may occur to other people.

data.title: Android build of game crashes with SDL Error
data.body:
Android build of my game crashes on tablet (Android 4.4.4, Intel) with SDL Error message, but works on phone.
You can get the build from: http://lunaen.com/games/fairy/#shopping (it's the second in list - Fairy: Shopping Day, PC build has sources included)
Screenshot of the error: https://www.dropbox.com/s/vjm1jeq433vnv0f/Screenshot_2016-03-20-17-40-01.png?dl=0
